newsitem.title: UK: Continental to see EC over BA/American deal.
newsitem.headline: Continental to see EC over BA/American deal.

text.p: Continental Airlines Inc said that it would be meeting on Friday with European Commission officials about its opposition to the proposed alliance between British Airways and American Airlines.

Continental's senior vice president for Europe Barry Simon told reporters that in addition to objecting to Britain's competition authorities he was meeting with EC transport and competition officials on Friday.
The Commission is examining the BA-American deal as part of a wider investigation into the European airline industry's transatlantic alliances.

Continental announced earlier that it was objecting to the findings of a separate investigation by Britain's Office of Fair Trading (OFT) which is said would allow a BA/American combine to dominate the transatlantic market.

Airlines and other interested parties have until tomorrow to make representations to the OFT on its proposals to conditionally approve the alliance provided BA and American release 168 weekly takeoff and landing slots at London Heathrow.
Instead Continental said it would need to be granted 140 weekly slots at Heathrow to allow it to become an effective rival to BA and American.
